required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess the Long-term Safety and Efficacy of a Subcutaneous Formulation of Efgartigimod PH20 SC in Adults With Pemphigus (Vulgaris or Foliaceus)
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Multicenter, Follow-up Trial of ARGX-113-1904 to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Efficacy of Efgartigimod PH20 SC in Patients With Pemphigus

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a prospective, multicenter, open label extension (OLE) trial on the efficacy, safety, patient outcome measures, tolerability, immunogenicity, PK and PD of efgartigimod PH20 SC in adult PV or PF participants, who participated in antecedent trial ARGX-113-1904. This trial provides extension of efgartigimod PH20 SC treatment and retreatment options for participants who have been randomized to efgartigimod PH20 SC treatment arm in the trial ARGX-113-1904, and the first treatment of efgartigimod PH20 SC and retreatment options for participants who had been randomized to placebo arm in trial ARGX-113-1904. Trial ARGX-113-1905 evaluates ability to (further) taper prednisone therapy and achieve Clinical Remission (CR) off therapy (CRoff), the ability to achieve CR and CR on minimal therapy (CRmin) for participants who had not yet achieved CRmin, and the ability to treat flare; and assess patient outcome measures and the safety, PD, PK and immunogenicity of efgartigimod PH20 SC over the duration of trial.
Study duration: Up to 60 weeks for participants who receive IMP administration up to 52 weeks and with a follow-up period of 8 weeks after the last IMP administration

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAE), Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESI), and Serious Adverse Events (SAE)
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAE), Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESI), and Serious Adverse Events (SAE)

primary_outcome.measure: Severity of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAE), Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESI), and Serious Adverse Events (SAE)
primary_outcome.description: Severity of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAE), Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESI), and Serious Adverse Events (SAE)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Pemphigus Vulgaris (PV) participants who achieve complete clinical remission (CR) on minimal prednisone therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with Pemphigus Vulgaris who achieve complete clinical remission on minimal prednisone therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Pemphigus Vulgaris (PV) and Pemphigus Foliaceus (PF) participants who achieve complete clinical remission (CR) on minimal prednisone dose therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with Pemphigus Vulgaris and Pemphigus Foliaceus who achieve complete clinical remission on minimal prednisone therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Disease Control (DC)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to Disease Control

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to complete clinical remission (CR)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to complete clinical remission

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to complete clinical remission (CR) on minimal prednisone therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Time to complete clinical remission on minimal prednisone therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to complete clinical remission (CR) off prednisone therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Time to complete clinical remission off prednisone therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to flare
secondary_outcome.description: Time to flare

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of treatment failure
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of treatment failure

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of flare
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of flare

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative prednisone dose over the trial
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative prednisone dose over the trial

secondary_outcome.measure: Pemphigus Disease Area Index (PDAI) at each visit
secondary_outcome.description: Pemphigus Disease Area Index at each visit

secondary_outcome.measure: EuroQol 5-Dimension 5-Level (EQ-5D-5L) score
secondary_outcome.description: EuroQol 5-Dimension 5-Level score

secondary_outcome.measure: Autoimmune Blister Quality of Life (ABQOL) score
secondary_outcome.description: Autoimmune Blister Quality of Life score

secondary_outcome.measure: Efgartigimod serum concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: Efgartigimod serum concentrations

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Immunoglobulin G and subtype (IgG1, IgG2, IgG3, IgG4) serum levels
secondary_outcome.description: Total Immunoglobulin G and subtype (IgG1, IgG2, IgG3, IgG4) serum levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-Desmoglein -1 and -3 autoantibodies serum levels
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-Desmoglein -1 and -3 autoantibodies serum levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-drug antibodies (ADAs) to efgartigimod (serum levels) and recombinant human hyaluronidase PH20 (plasma levels)
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-drug antibodies to efgartigimod (serum levels) and recombinant human hyaluronidase PH20 (plasma levels)

secondary_outcome.measure: Composite Glucocorticoid Toxicity Index (C-GTI) comprising the Aggregate Improvement Score (AIS) and the Cumulative Worsening Score (CWS)
secondary_outcome.description: Composite Glucocorticoid Toxicity Index comprising the Aggregate Improvement Score and the Cumulative Worsening Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who performed self-administration
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who performed self-administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of caregivers who administered the injection to the participant
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of caregivers who administered the injection to the participant

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of visits needed for the participant or caregiver to be competent to start administering efgartigimod PH20 SC
secondary_outcome.description: Number of visits needed for the participant or caregiver to be competent to start administering efgartigimod PH20 SC

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of self- or caregiver-supported administration at home
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of self- or caregiver-supported administration at home

arm_group.description: patients receiving efgartigimod PH20 SC on top of prednisone

intervention.description: Subcutaneous injection of efgartigimod using rHuPH20 (PH20) as a permeation enhancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Ability to understand the requirements of the trial, to provide written informed consent (including consent for the use and disclosure of research-related health information), willingness and ability to comply with the trial protocol procedures (including required trial visits).
2. The participant participated in trial ARGX-113-1904 and completed the study or has the defined criteria for rollover.
3. Contraceptive use by men and women should be consistent with local regulations regarding the methods for contraception for those participating clinical trials and:
1. Male participants: Male participants must agree to use acceptable method of contraception, and not donate sperm from signing the ICF until the end of the study
2. Female participants Women of childbearing potential must:
- have a negative serum pregnancy test at screening and negative urine pregnancy test at baseline before the IMP can be administered,
- agree to use a highly effective or acceptable contraception method, which should be maintained at minimum until 90 days after the last dose of IMP
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnant and lactating women and those intending to become pregnant during the trial or within 90 days after the last administration of IMP.
2. Participants with clinical evidence of other significant serious disease or participants who recently underwent or have planned a major surgery during the period of the trial, or any other condition in the opinion of the investigator, that could confound the results of the trial or put the participant at undue risk.
3. Known hypersensitivity to any of the components of the administered treatments.
